title: Fractional part
summary: The fractional part or decimal part[1] of a non‐negative real number x {\displaystyle x} is the excess beyond that number's integer part. If the latter is defined as the largest integer not greater than x, called floor of x or ⌊ x ⌋ {\displaystyle \lfloor x\rfloor } , its fractional part can be written as:
